title: Graves needs beat with a Nerf Bat
body:
In his current state, Graves is entirely too tanky to fit his "ADC" Role. 

He's able to build whatever he wants and still do an immense amount of damage thanks to his overloaded kit. At the very least, remove the stacking and refreshing resistances from his E.  Once he gets into teamfights, the resistances literally only go away if he dies because he can continuously refresh and stack those resistances making him tankier than our beloved Archduke Susan except Graves has more sustained damage and ~~a cigar~~ better facial hair.

EDIT: Even Lord Dyrone doesn't have a way to beat this guy other than to make sure you camp him to death.

I assume you meant "not fed". Which i disagree with - Graves was more fed than the Jhin. Graves had 11950 gold worth of items + baron. Jhin had 11050. 

And lets look at what happened - Jhin has a horrible build (building only 20% crit? Graves had more crit than Jhin did). Also, Jhin decided to walk into melee range of Graves while reloading. This means 2 things - 1) You get hit by more pellets, so graves does more damage to you than if you stayed at max autoattack range, and 2) you cant attack during those 2.5 seconds anyway so it was free damage. Jhin is not a dualing ADC. Standing there attacking a champion with lifesteal/crit/damage/attack speed isnt the way to play Jhin. He relies on kiting and poking (Which again, goes to build - getting a zeal item allows you to move a large distance between crits so graves cant continuously auto you). 

Next Jhin got hit with the second part of Graves Q. That shouldnt happen. 

Jhin attacked a minion with his 2nd to last bullet. 

Jhin decided to W (which has a long cast animation) instead of getting his last auto which would have done around 1500 damage. Autoing would have gotten the kill since Graves was at around 500 health. Instead, Jhin decides to cast his W (which he missed anyway). 

Skarner played that wrong. Skarner should position himself between the Graves and the Jhin. Grave's autos cant go past units, so Skarner could have blocked every single auto if he was positioned correctly. Skarner went zero damage. Why wasnt he soaking damage?
________________________________

If you look at the other side, Graves played that perfectly. He kited away from the Jhin during his reloading, and flash-Auto x2 in melee range.
No other adc is able to do this, nor should they. The problem is that Graves is taking extremely little damage, while doing fuck tons back.
He's not overloaded, he's overtuned. He doesn't have a shitton of excessive mechanics. He simply needs basically all his numbers reduced.
Thank you. People spout overloaded without even knowing what the term means so much these days.

Just nerf the fact that each bullet of his autos apply lifesteal because late game each bullet makes it so his autos do FAR more than 100% of his AD. If only one bullet applies lifesteal, late game he still has full lifesteal because one bullet will deal 100% ad (the reason it ends up doing more is because of the ad stacking if all bullets hit) and it will also nerf his INSANE early lane sustain with Warlord's, Doran's Blade, and the Vampirism mastery.

I agree with others, the tankiness is a nice change of pace for adcs, in a way. I think the magnitude is too much; it could stand to go down quite a bit.

But also, he really needs his burst hit... THAT'S what REALLY doesn't jive with being an adc. The only class that has both good burst and good sustained damage are AD assassins, and they pay for it by being squishy, as well as being melee, neither of which graves has right now. I love the close-range, tanky style of an adc. It's refreshing for the game. But for graves to get right in your face and decimate you with little to no counterplay, like an adc assassin, in addition to that? Just too much.

We can all agree that there's one thing that needs to go in his kit to make him alright. OP thinks it's the tanky, other commenters think it's the sustained dmg, and I think it's the burst. But yes, he needs nerfs. Let's all at least agree on that.
